pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:0.5: 30. The training rule on even levels
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six received almsfood in a heap. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.3: “‘I will receive almsfood on an even level,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.4: Almsfood is to be received on an even level.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.5: If a monk receives almsfood in a heap out of disrespect, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.7: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.10: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.11: The third chapter on arms akimbo is finished.
